Action.author: ratnakar
Action.body: *grpc.max_send_message_length* GRPC RECEIVE ----> *grpc.max_receive_message_length* Tests are passed when used the following grpc options {code} grpc-max-send-message-length grpc-max-receive-message-length {code} ~harrisob@us.ibm.com Did we deprecated these grpc flags *grpc.max_send_message_length* & *grpc.max_receive_message_length* from NodeJS SDK V1.2 ? >

Action.author: harrisob@us.ibm.com
Action.body: This is working as designed, the code has been restructured to make sure that the v10 names are used before the real grpc names. The old test case does not remove the v10 name, so the setting is still there when the real grpc name is set. The old test case is not correct.

Action.author: userlinuxuser
Action.body: Modify the file network-config.yaml, orderers -> grpcOptions: grpc-max-send-message-length: -1 and peers -> ...
